creator: clark.updike@jhuapl.edu
text:
The Automatic Application Deployment documentation fails to warn users that a 
webapp placed under the appbase will be loaded twice if there is a context 
entry and the context path is different from the docbase path.  The 
documentation doesn't mention this behaviour (or I couldn't find it) and 
implies that the webapp will be loaded only once with the overriding context 
settings.   

Also Ref: http://w6.metronet.com/~wjm/tomcat/2000/May/msg00439.html

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The issue is that the docs is sometimes slightly incomplete. In all cases, it is
not written with a book writing style. The info is there, though: host will
autoDeploy webapps, and apps declared in server.xml will also get auto deployed.
This logically implies that the app may be deployed twice if the deploy paths
aren't the same.

I think additional "user" docs should be written (volunteers needed), using a
different perspecticve.
You can also buy a book (plenty of Tomcat books have been released since the bug
was filed).
